TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE ( GPE ) .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant ’s plot of land and his house were expropriated in DATE and DATE respectively by the local municipality . He was compensated with CARDINAL apartments . In DATE the ORG adopted a law on the restitution of property expropriated under planning and other legislation ( ORG за възстановяване собствеността върху някои отчуждени имоти по ORG , ORG , ORG , ORG и ЗС ) ( see below Relevant domestic law ) .

On DATE the applicant requested restitution of his property from the GPE Deputy - Mayor . On DATE the municipal board on architecture and construction issued its opinion according to which a road and a building were built over the expropriated plot of land . On DATE the committee in which the appropriate power was vested regarding the restitution of expropriated property expressed the opinion the plot of land should not be returned , regard being had to the fact that it had already been built over .

On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant repeated his request . By letter of DATE , he was informed by the deputy - mayor that the municipality had been processing his request , the delay being due to the large number of similar applications .
On DATE the applicant ’s request was rejected by the mayor on the ground that the project for which his property had been expropriated , namely a road and a building , was completed .

On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision to ORG through the municipality . He requested the court to order the preparation of an expert report regarding his property . On DATE the applicant ’s appeal was received by the court , on DATE it was assigned to a panel of judges and on DATE the court appointed an expert .

The expert report of DATE stated , inter alia , that the road had been closed , the constructed building had been demolished and that the claimed land constituted an independent plot according to the relevant regulations as in force in DATE .
On DATE the court held a hearing . The applicant stated that he did not intend to give back the CARDINAL apartments received as compensation .

On DATE the court dismissed the applicant ’s appeal holding that the legal conditions for the restitution of the applicant ’s expropriated land were not met since he did not intend to give back the CARDINAL apartments by which he had been compensated .

On DATE the applicant submitted a petition for review to ORG complaining , inter alia , that the lower court did not take into consideration the expert report and the fact that the value of the plot of land had diminished .
Following the adoption of LAW , on DATE , ORG was split into ORG and ORG .
On DATE the applicant declared before a notary that he would return the apartments if he received back the plot of land with the house which had been demolished and an adequate compensation .

On DATE ORG opened case - file no . CARDINAL regarding the applicant ’s petition for review . At the hearing of DATE , the applicant declared his determination to return the apartments at issue . By judgment of DATE , the court quashed the decision of ORG and instructed it to examine whether the applicant ’s property had been expropriated on the basis of CARDINAL of the laws mentioned in the restitution law , whether the project for which the property had been expropriated had been completed on the date on which the restitution law had entered into force and whether the preconditions set out in the restitution law for the annulment of the expropriation had been fulfilled .

ORG held its first hearing on DATE . The applicant declared that he would return the apartments only if a new house were built by the municipality . The applicant applied for leave to adduce additional evidence and the hearing was adjourned .
The hearing resumed on CARDINAL DATE . The applicant again applied for leave to adduce additional evidence and the hearing was adjourned .
At the hearing of DATE , the applicant again stated that he would not give back the CARDINAL apartments .
On DATE the ORG quashed the mayor ’s decision of DATE and the expropriation orders of DATE and DATE . It held that the legal conditions set out in the restitution law had been fulfilled .
Upon the applicant ’s requests in DATE , ORG corrected some errors in its DATE judgment .
On DATE the municipality filed a cassation appeal with ORG through ORG . On DATE the applicant was served with a copy .
On DATE the ORG transmitted the cassation appeal to ORG . The hearing was held on DATE .

On DATE ORG , at a public hearing , quashed ORG decision and upheld the mayor ’s decision of DATE . It noted that the applicant had chosen of his own will to request restitution of a plot of land , although the expropriated house had been demolished and it had been clear under the relevant law that he would have to give back the CARDINAL apartments which he had received in compensation . On several occasions the applicant had declared before the court his unwillingness to give up the apartments . Therefore , there was no clear and unconditional request for restitution . As regards the applicant ’s request for compensation , the court held that it had not had jurisdiction to examine that issue , but the applicant would have to institute civil proceedings in this regard .
Throughout the proceedings the applicant was not legally represented .
DATE PERSON on the restitution of property expropriated under planning and other legislation

This law provides that former owners , or their heirs , of real estate which had been expropriated pursuant to several particular pieces of legislation could request , within DATE of the law 's entry into force , the restoration of their rights under certain conditions .

In the case of plots of land where an existing building was demolished , its restitution was possible only if the practical execution of the project for which the property had been expropriated had not commenced and the expropriated land had a sufficient surface to constitute an independent plot under the planning regulations ( LAW ) . Also , the former owners were required to return what they had received in compensation ( Sections CARDINAL ) .
